dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Conversational and critical, but based on misinformation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we've gotta talk about Jeff Bezos's recent trip to India. Uh, it sounds like it was... quite the chaotic affair.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we've gotta talk about Jeff Bezos's recent trip to India. Uh, it sounds like it was... quite the chaotic affair.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Chaotic is an understatement, honestly. I heard he, like, retracted a major pledge? And was booed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Chaotic is an understatement, honestly. I heard he, like, retracted a major pledge? And was booed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025. The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. He, um, announced his company would now import, like, $10 billion worth of goods from India by 2025. Not the original pledge, apparently. And this was met with *boos*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. He, um, announced his company would now import, like, ten billion dollars worth of goods from India by twenty twenty five. Not the original pledge, apparently. And this was met with boos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025...was met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And that happened at, like, a public event?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And that happened at, like, a public event?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, actually. That's the kicker. It was a closed-door meeting, not the big Amazon Smbhav event. This meeting was specifically intended to condemn Amazon's practices by the Indian government and small business owners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, actually. That's the kicker. It was a closed-door meeting, not the big Amazon Smbhav event. This meeting was specifically intended to condemn Amazon's practices by the Indian government and small business owners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it was already a hostile room. No wonder. But still, a retraction? I mean, India's the world's seventh-largest economy. That feels like a slap in the face.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it was already a hostile room. No wonder. But still, a retraction? I mean, India's the world's seventh-largest economy. That feels like a slap in the face.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the worlds seventh-largest economy as measured by GDP, the goodwill from Bezos toward India is necessary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And get this: their antitrust watchdog just abandoned a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing, you know, after Amazon threatened legal action.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And get this: their antitrust watchdog just abandoned a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing, you know, after Amazon threatened legal action.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, so Amazon gets probed, threatens to sue, and then the probe just... goes away? And the government, like, eased e-commerce regulations for foreign retailers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so Amazon gets probed, threatens to sue, and then the probe just... goes away? And the government, like, eased e-commerce regulations for foreign retailers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. While simultaneously, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized businesses organized celebrations in 300 cities *in support* of Amazon. It's so contradictory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. While simultaneously, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized businesses organized celebrations in three hundred cities in support of Amazon. It's so contradictory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild. And then there's the personal touch from Bezos. He, um, reportedly refused to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild. And then there's the personal touch from Bezos. He, um, reportedly refused to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos, the richest man in the world, has not made any announcements about meeting with Prime Minister Narenda Modi. An Amazon spokesperson declined to comment on the specifics of the India trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. And Modi, who's already facing heavy criticism for his economic policies, actually welcomed the retraction of the pledge. Like, he's just trying to get more funding, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. And Modi, who's already facing heavy criticism for his economic policies, actually welcomed the retraction of the pledge. Like, he's just trying to get more funding, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India... But Bezos pledge during Amazon Smbhav should be welcome news for the head of state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he abandoned his $5 trillion economy goal. And India's GDP is actually expected to shrink by 2025 partly due to Amazon's practices. It just doesn't add up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he abandoned his five trillion dollar economy goal. And India's G D P is actually expected to shrink by twenty twenty five partly due to Amazon's practices. It just doesn't add up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024. Indias GDP in 2018 was $2.6 trillion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the diplomacy was just... harsh. He posted videos, like, defacing the Raj Ghat, which is a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. And he wouldn't interact with teenagers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the diplomacy was just... harsh. He posted videos, like, defacing the Raj Ghat, which is a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. And he wouldn't interact with teenagers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the speech! I saw this clip. He said, 'I predict that the 21st century is going to be the end of the Indian century.' What was that even about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the speech! I saw this clip. He said, I predict that the twenty first century is going to be the end of the Indian century. What was that even about?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And then he goes on to say the most important alliance will be between the US, the world's oldest democracy, and the world's *smallest* democracy. He literally said 'smallest.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And then he goes on to say the most important alliance will be between the U S, the world's oldest democracy, and the world's smallest democracy. He literally said smallest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United Statesthe worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Smallest? I mean, that has to be a slip, right? Or, like, a deliberate jab? Either way, talk about a diplomatic disaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Smallest? I mean, that has to be a slip, right? Or, like, a deliberate jab? Either way, talk about a diplomatic disaster.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It just seems like a series of missteps and, uh, frankly, pretty offensive gestures during what was supposed to be a significant visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It just seems like a series of missteps and, uh, frankly, pretty offensive gestures during what was supposed to be a significant visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a really strange and, like, confusing message he sent to India, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a really strange and, like, confusing message he sent to India, for sure.
